text: local news in Kazakh Stan reporting on a
woman being detained for demanding the
right to wear lace knickers why are you
afraid of panties she shouts freedom to
panties as she's forced into a police
van it's a new law that's set to come
into effect not only in Kazakhstan but
in Russia in Belarus on the 1st of July
it will outlaw any underwear containing
less than 6% of cotton from being
imported made or sold in the three
countries which are under the customs
union led by Russia women can still buy
them when they go abroad just now
gorgeous underwear from foreign brands
has become available in Russia's free
market if you take that away again the
buyer is going to be the one who suffers
the most
amid consumer outrage customs union
officials said they were preparing to
issue a statement soon but for many it's
yet another example of the misguided
economic policies that have become a
trademark of many post-soviet countries
Marie COI BBC News
